remarks: "Darapti", one of the syllogisms of Aristotelian logic.  All ` ph ` is ` ps ` , all ` ph ` is ` ch ` , and some ` ph ` exist, therefore some ` ch ` is ` ps ` .  (In Aristotelian notation, AAI-3:  MaP and MaS therefore SiP.) For example, "All squares are rectangles" and "All squares are rhombuses", therefore "Some rhombuses are rectangles". (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 28-Aug-2016.)
statement:
darapti.maj $e |- A. x ( ph -> ps ) $.
darapti.min $e |- A. x ( ph -> ch ) $.
darapti.e $e |- E. x ph $.
darapti $p |- E. x ( ch /\ ps ) $.
